alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 17 at 12:36AM EDT until May 17 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN CHESTERFIELD, SOUTH CENTRAL HENRICO AND SOUTHEASTERN POWHATAN COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 1236 AM EDT, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. No additional rainfall is expected tonight. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Richmond, Bon Air, Bensley, Bellwood, Midlothian, Holly Hills, Drewrys Bluff, Richmond Heights, Flat Rock and Montrose. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not stay in areas subject to flooding when water begins rising.

area.areaDesc: Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico; Powhatan
